result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Stokes Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count one, but consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Pay all remaining costs, surcharges, asessments including the DV surcharge. Bail to apply, if any.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.

No illegal drugs.
No contact with victim except for phone contact.  No other modification without the approval of the agent.  May have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
No firearms.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling.
Pay supervision fees.
Obtain and AODA assessment and follow up treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Report in by 11/25/2015.
Huber/release privileges if working.

Pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail, the defendant is to pay during the period of probation.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Count two.

Defendant Derrick Stokes Carter in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by:  Sherita C.
As to count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 11 months at the House of Correction with Huber/release privileges if working, and 21 days credit.  Defendant is to report in by 11/25/2015.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges during the period of probation, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm and is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
.
As to count 1:
 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 years, with credit for -0- DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 year; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. 
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS, concurrent with count 1 but consecutive to any other sentence,  with the following conditions:
*   Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*   Obtain an AODA assessment and follow-up treatment;
*   Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens - no illegal drugs; 
*   No contact with victim except for phone contact.  No other modification without the approval of the agent.  
*   Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
*   No firearms.
*   Pay supervision fees;
*   Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge;
*   Pay all remaining costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DV surcharge,  bail to apply, if any, remaining costs and surcharges are to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
.
Filed Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 669
cf
Sentencing hearing at 11-18-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Derrick Stokes Carter in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Nicole Sprewer, 911 dispatch operator, Milwaukee Police Officers, Aja Chirpke and Lawrence Pope.
Exhibits 1 through 11 received.   State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  The court was informed that the defendant does not wish to testify.
Jury in the box.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  

Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror John S. selected by lot.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:30 p.m. to deliberate in charge of Deputy Sheriffs Randall Tackacs and Dickson Woo who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
.
At the hour of 4:54 p.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson, Susan D.,  brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO BOTH COUNTS which was then read.    Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Stokes Carter in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
.
Defense counsel filed a motion to exclude the 911 tape.  After listencing to the tape the court ordered it admissible.
.
Jury trial proceeds.
.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:50 a.m..  

Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause and who were duly impaneled and sworn at 12:05 p.m..  Jury list received and filed.
Court ordered witnesses sequestered. 
.
Court adjourned for the lunch hour....
.

Defendant Derrick Stokes Carter in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was scheduled for jury trial today.
Defense informs the court that he never received, until today, the name of the 911 operator and is requesting an adjournment, which was granted by the court.
Case adjourned to Branch 36 for another jury trial date.
  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from the defense received and filed.

Defendant Derrick Stokes Carter in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Discussion regarding discovery. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 36 on 08/19/2015 at 8:30am. 

Statement by Sherita Q. regarding modifying the no contact order. Court will not modify the no contact order. The State gave a subpoena to Sherita Q. to appear on 08/19/2015 at 8:30am. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Status Report: Case worker advises court that report submitted on 7/6/2015 in error. Defendant is in compliance with terms of Justice Point Supervision.
Final pre-trial on August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Telephone Contact.

Defendant Derrick Stokes Carter NOT in court, appearance waived with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at request of branch 36. Matter set for Final Pretrial on 8/11/2015. Branch 36 is not in session on that day of Final Pretrial date. Court VACATED the Final Pretrial date, matter is rescheduled for Final Pretrial before branch 36.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Telephone Contact. Court advised attorney McGinn that the defendant needs to regain contact and come into compliance before he is discharged. If discharged court will re-address this matter.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court allows for Electronic & Telephone Contact ONLY, parties not to discuss this case.

Defendant Derrick Stokes Carter in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn. Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
